text: The 2016 La Course by Le Tour de France was the third edition of La Course by Le Tour de France, a one-day women's cycle race held in France. The race was held before the final stage of the 2016 Tour de France on 24 July. It was organised by the ASO and is part of the UCI Women's World Tour. It was won by Chloe Hosking of . ==Teams competing== {| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:33%;"| ===UCI Women's Teams=== :Alé–Cipollini–Galassia :Astana Women's Team :Bepink :Boels–Dolmans :BTC City Ljubljana :Canyon–SRAM :Cervélo–Bigla Pro Cycling :Cylance Pro Cycling :Lensworld.eu–Zannata :Lotto–Soudal Ladies :Orica–AIS :Parkhotel Valkenburg Continental Team :Poitou–Charentes.Futuroscope.86 :Rabo–Liv Women Cycling Team :Team Hitec Products :Team Liv–Plantur :Tibco–Silicon Valley Bank :Topsport Vlaanderen–Pro-Duo :UnitedHealthcare Women's Team :Wiggle High5 Pro Cycling | style="vertical-align:top; width:33%;"| ===National team=== :France | style="vertical-align:top; width:33%;"| | style="vertical-align:top; width:25%;"| |} ==Race== Ellen van Dijk escaped solo during the race ==Result== {| |Race result {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#ccccff;" ! !Cyclist !Team !Time |- | align=center |1 | | | align=right | 2h 01' 27" |- | align=center |2 | | | align=right | + 0" |- | align=center |3 | | | align=right | + 0" |- | align=center |4 | | | align=right | + 0" |- | align=center |5 | | | align=right | + 0" |- | align=center |6 | | | align=right | + 0" |- | align=center |7 | | | align=right | + 0" |- | align=center |8 | | | align=right | + 0" |- | align=center |9 | | | align=right | + 0" |- | align=center |10 | | | align=right | + 0" |} Source |} ==See also== * 2016 in women's road cycling ==References== ==External links== * La Course Category:La Course by Le Tour de France La Course
